N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 32.6 - Verification of insurance coverage (validity of id cards)

State Regulations
(a) Mandatory
verification (MVF). Insurance companies shall respond to DMV initiated MVF
transactions in full accordance with the provisions of Part 34 of this Title. MVF transactions primarily represent the verification of ID cards when required
electronic proof of insurance is not posted to DMV's insurance information
database. The department may, as necessary, request specific verification of
insurance coverage from motorists as a result of occurrences that indicate
operation of a motor vehicle such as accident reports, conviction certificates, and requests from the public or other agencies. Upon receipt of a response from
the motorist, the department shall initiate a MVF transaction to the identified
insurance company if DMV's insurance information database does not at that time
confirm insurance coverage. (b) Each insurance company shall provide the department with a single electronic
value added network (VAN) mailbox address to receive MVF transactions as
required by Part 34 of this Title. In addition, each insurance company shall
provide the commissioner with a single authorized name and mailing address, e-mail address and telephone number of a person designated to receive manual
MVF transactions for dealer/transporter registrations and as may be otherwise
required by the commissioner. Insurance companies shall respond to DMV
initiated electronic and manual verification of ID cards accepted by the
department within the prescribed return transactions specified by and in full
accordance with the time frames set forth in Part 34 of this Title. Notes
